episodes.title: Trad Wives, High Control Religious Groups & Cults
episodes.description: In this episode we discuss the Trad Wife trend, including Ballerina Farms' Hannah Neeleman and the women from The Secret Lives of Mormon Wives. We also discuss author Tia Leving's appearance on the We Can Do Hard Things podcast. Tia escaped a high control religious group and was featured in the documentary Shiny Happy People. subjects: The Church Of Jesus Christ Of Latter-Day Saints

episodes.title: Dancing for the Devil: The 7M Tik Tok Cult
episodes.description:
This documentary follows a group of young adult dancers and social media influencers with large TikTok and Instagram followings who unwittingly become part of a cult led by Robert Shinn. This cult extended to Shinn's church, Shekinah Church, in Los Angeles, California. Concerned parents race against time to uncover the truth behind the 7M Cult and rescue their children before it's too late. Sisters Melanie and Priscylla Lee, who were effectively orphaned as children and taken in by Shekinah, only to be abused for decades, are also featured. They file a lawsuit against Shinn and Shekinah for damages for theirs and others' years of abuse.

episodes.title: Love Has Won: The Cult of Mother God
episodes.description: This three part docuseries chronicles the life and death of Amy Carlson, also known as Mother God, a self-proclaimed spiritual savior who built a cult. Carlson and her followers believed she was God, a 19 billion year old being and a reincarnation of Jesus Christ. Calrson's body was found mummified in the compound of the group in April of 2021 in Crestone, Colorado. Her cause of death was found to be from chronic alcohol abuse, chronic anorexia, organ failure and colloidal silver ingestion. Please SUBSCRIBE to the podcast and give us a 5-star rating and review. We are on Instagram and TikTok @psychlegalpop Email: psychlegalpoppodcast@gmail.com
